Reviews.Title: “saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: GaelB241
Reviews.Content: as if having a fabulous location, a really nice little room, and friendly and helpful staff wasn't enough... Chris, the owner, stepped in when our bags were lost and saved our trip. She made phone calls to the airlines and the baggage handlers and our bags were returned. We loved out time in Sydney and loved the City Crown! The cafe would have been a nice cafe even if it wasn't attached to the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been better with non-leaky air con and minus the cockroach”
Reviews.Author: Andi_L255057
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I was pleased with this motel on first impressions. The owner is helpful and friendly, the location is fantastic, the cafe does superb food and coffee. Yes, the room is a little old and 'worn', but then, as long as it's clean and comfortable, that is fine. But that was the problem. On getting back from a gig in the evening I found a big cockroach had decided to move in. I decided to just live with it as I was exhausted and wanted to go to sleep. It had been a warm day, so I put on the air con to cool the room down a little. A few minutes later I hear a rush of water and, on turning the light back on, found that the air con was leaking... a lot. I went down to get the night watchman. He did come to my room with a can of bug spray and he did place the bin under the air con, but that was it. I got to spend the rest of the evening hearing the air con drip away and keeping an eye out for the cockroach (I ended up 'sleeping' with the light on both nights I was there - I don't like cockroaches). I told the owner the next day and she apologised, giving me a complimentary breakfast at the cafe. I suppose that was some compensation, but I am afraid not enough to make me stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central - Rough”
Reviews.Author: 221MikeM
Reviews.Content: The central location and the chap on reception were nice but that is it as far as good comments. My room smelt very weird (almost overpowering) and when i arrived at the airport my suitcase still smelt of the room. The room itself looked relatively clean on the surface but was still felt dirty and you wouldn't want to sit on anything. The WIFI wouldn't work in my room at all and i was told that its because my laptop is too new (total rubbish). This is most likely one of the excuses when anyone complains. I never normally consider writing a review as most places are either ok or good however i felt i had to after staying there. Basic and dated would be nice. It is one of the worst places i have ever stayed in,

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Kate O
Reviews.Content: This little motel was perfect for my needs. I stayed here to attend a conference. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, shower hot and the TV great! It didn't bother me that my room did not have a view as I was only in the room to sleep. I was able to walk at night very close to the hotel to get a brilliant dinner and a late night coffee (which was great tasting, I might add). During the day I was able to go for a pleasant stroll and found an awesome park and brilliant shops! The staff could not be more helpful and warm. There were an abundance of free DVDs and great free wifi. The hotel is old and the walls to the rooms thin so you hear what is going on outside BUT if you sleep well then don't let this deter you from all the positives surrounding this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JasonSyd1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have stayed here twice now, once for a night and most recently for four nights. The booking process was easy. Check in was quick and hassle free, and the motel staff were always friendly and helpful. The room was very basic and dated, but at $140 a night you can't go wrong. The room was clean, spacious enough and the location unbeatable. The pillows were a little hard though resulting in a sore neck on a few occasions (if I have to be fussy). The cafe downstairs was lovely, and the reception desk have a wide range of DVDs you can take free of charge. Overall, if you are after basic accommodation in an amazing location, you can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great city accommodation”
Reviews.Author: fstech
Reviews.Content: Had to find accommodation for 7 close to SFS and city and found this gem. Clean, comfortable beds, very quiet, fabulous cafe out front and very friendly staff. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: BigTrip11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in a double room with a balcony. We arrived late at night and the guy at reception was very nice and friendly. Our room was good it had a big bed and tv but the bathroom had a leek in the roof quite badly too. The balcony area was amazing, in the morning we looked down on queen street and the courtyard area where the motel also has a cafe and it was very busy with people having there breakfast that looked delicious. All the autumn trees were beautiful aswell. On the first night we had a bit of a problem with dvd player (as you can watch as many as you want from the collection at reception) and the guy kindly came and got us a new one at midnight. It's in such a nice area surrounded by cool restaurants and shops. It's very clean. We loved our weekend in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bourboncatt
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this location. It's nothing fancy but it is clean and well appointed and in the best part of Sydney. Being right in the city of course it is going to be a bit noisy but that the hustle and bustle added excitement to our stay. We will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Budget, basic option in hip location - but beware of the noise”
Reviews.Author: scotthumphries
Reviews.Content: I had booked and prepaid for 2 nights here this past weekend. That I ended up leaving after one night to stay at another, more expensive hotel and forfeited the $150 I had prepaid at City Crown tells you something of my experience and means you probably don't need to read much further. First, the positives. Staff are nice. Bathroom (renovated in the past 5-7 years I'd say) is simple but clean, as are the towels and manchester. Furnishings look tired but the carpet is new as is the flat screen TV. There is actually not very much accommodaiton available around Surry Hills-Darlinghurst, and what is available tends to be very expensive. Many of the older hotels and motels in this area have been converted into apartment buildings, leaving few options for travellers wnating to stay in this cool area and even fewer options for those on a budget. So the City Crown fills a big gap for people looking for basic, no frills budget accommodation in a cool and happening area - similar to Snooze Inn in Brisbane's Fortitude Valley or Hotel Saville in Melbourne's South Yarra. Another big plus is the complimentary wi-fi. Again, it shows that the most basic, budget properties in Australia are streets ahead of the 4 and 5 star properties who still charge through the noise for internet, totalyl out of step with the rest of the world. So that is a big positive for the City Crown. But, you do pay a price for those positives. In my case, it was a lot of noise. My room (12) was located right next to the front door, which meant I had to listen to it opening and slamming shut all night long, and the loud conversations of other guests arriving home after a night out. This got s bit dull around 4am. The paper thing door to my room meant I could also hear the phone ringing across the room in reception and all the details of the phone calls as well. Not to mention all the clomp-clomp-clomping of the person working on reception that night, who may or may not wear clogs. Even ear plugs did not help. So, in the end I found that the 'savings' of a budget room were not offset by the inconvenience of the noise and the no frills level of comfort for the room. I moved to another hotel which was much better for only $50 more. If the City Crown was super cheap - say, $100 a night - then I could overlook the noise and the basic facilities. But at $150 per night I think it is just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Basic amenities in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: J0_mc
Reviews.Content: 1. Was the hotel close to things (e.g. transport, attractions, restaurants)? Excellent location. Very short walk to Kings Cross, Sydney business district, Surry Hills shops and cafes, and Darlinghurst shops and cafes. Trains and buses to anywhere also very close. 2. Was the hotel in a safe area? As safe as Darlinghurst gets, but i wouldn't park my car on the street. 3. Was there much noise at night? My room faced onto Crown Street, which is a major and busy street going all night. There was no wall soundproofing, so that caused quite a lot of pedestrian and traffic noise. I could also fairly clearly hear the activities going on in several other rooms on my floor... 4. What was the quality and cleanliness of the hotel furniture and fittings like (e.g. bed, lock-up safe, shower)? Very basic furniture that looked a bit worn, although comfortable, clean and functional. No place to hang up clothes, just a shelf. No lock up safe. 5. Do the hotel staff provide a good service (e.g. competence, attitude, availability)? Staff were very friendly and easily available. 6. What were the hotel amenities like (e.g. breakfast, restaurant, pool, bar, car parking)? Cafe downstairs was excellent. Secure car parking available underneath hotel for a small number of cars, which is a rare find in this part of the city. 7. Did the room come with extras (e.g. minibar, TV, internet, air-con, tea making facility)? Large TV, reverse cycle airconditioning, tea making facilities available. 8. Other / general comments: Besides the noise coming from outside and other rooms, i really liked this hotel due to its location, staff, and car parking and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bluemountainkiwi
Reviews.Content: Just returned from New Years Eve at City Crown Motel and although it is hard to judge value for money on the rate we paid, it was NYE Sydney style and the price reflected this. That said the rooms were clean and quite comfortable for what would be a standard tariff. The view from the small balcony was actually better than alot of bigger 4-5 star motels. As is often the case with a smaller family run motel the service from the time we arrived till the time we departed was excellent and although I never got the womans name she was a true gem and made us feel most welcome. Nothing was a hassle to her. An added bonus to City Crown Hotel is Room 9, the cafe at street level which was great for recovery breakfast New Years morning. Overall I would rate City Crown Motel as being ideally located close to Oxford St and city with good secure parking and being good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “To be avoided- please read”
Reviews.Author: att_81
Reviews.Content: We booked this motel in advance as there was little available at this peak time. On arrival we were greeted by Chris (who advised us she was the owner) Chris was lovely and genuine, a very warm welcome. We were allocated Room 15 which stunk of mould the moment we opened the door, the room was riddled with insects as the balcony door appeared to have been left open prior to our arrival (possibly in a failed attempt to mask the smell of mould, the door did not have a fly screen). We went out and purchased some insect spray to kill the bugs and slept with hundreds of dead bugs on the floor, with the smell of insect repellant in the air, not a great first night! We also noticed our bedding was not clean properly and we found hair (not own our under the pillow case). On the second day of our stay our room was not serviced and we had to ask reception for fresh towels twice! (our first request seemed to have been forgotten, with no apology). We woke in the mornings to loud noise, it seemed as though perhaps the place was going through some minor renovations (which it needed). In summary a great location, lovely owner and we were not charged for late checkout,but this did not discount the fact that we had to put up with the smell of mould to the point of feeling ill!

Reviews.Title: “Good Position, Housekeeping Needs work”
Reviews.Author: concertNsw
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights motel position is excellent but housekeeping leaves alot to be desired, blankets on single bed were full of Hair (not ours) we removed the blanket and quilt and used our own bedding. Floor near balcony door was saturated not sure why could not find any reason for the wet floor. There is secure parking but in saying this we had to hand over our car keys so that our car could be moved in and out of the garage so other cars to be either parked or leave the garage we have a scratch up the passenger door that was not there when we arrived at the motel and we did not park anywhere else. The Staff was very nice and friendly

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and basic!”
Reviews.Author: sophc19
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 1 night. Walking from central station was not a good idea, and it was even daylight. The receptionist lady was the only good thing about this place we thought. Extremely small room, holes in curtains, paper thin walls, musty sheets, badly designed bathroom which left our floor all wet, box TV, matchbox balcony and trees obscuring our 'city view' which we payed the higher price for. Don't be deceived by the pictures, very basic and not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as advertised, will definitely stay next time I'm in Syd”
Reviews.Author: DjinnAgain
Reviews.Content: First off, I had to change my booking twice (once at nearly the last minute) due to stuff arounds at work and expected a surcharge or at least a bit of surliness. Didn't get either, the staff were friendly and helpful right from the off. Huge bed, comfy, not too much storage space but leaving my case on spare single bed was fine for me. Nice balcony area. Lovely check in staff and when I returned at night and couldn't find the remote for the heater staff hunted a spare one down with a smile and let me know that I should just ring reception if the kids next door stayed noisy and said they would tell them to pipe down soon which was nice because while it was still pretty early on a Friday night and I didn't want to be a killjoy it was nice to know that it wouldn't go on endlessly. Rooms spotless with everything one needs. I was actually expecting more basic amenities based on the reviews here and the room rate which was VERY reasonable for Sydney but it definitely exceeded my expectations. Great area lots of nice restaurants and bars nearby and a quick walk to central business district. Will definitely stay again next time I'm in town. The Ibis where I've stayed before for work was three times the price for terrible service and comfort and zero soul. City Crown beats them on all levels. Didn't take any photo's because everything is EXACTLY as pictured on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money motel -helpful & friendly staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: AyrLindaD
Reviews.Content: Situated in the trendy Surry Hills area - this is a great little motel that really is value for money. Staff very helpful and always friendly and it has a great little breakfast /snack/coffee shop attached serving wonderful breakfast. The owner Tony is always around and looks after everybody and keeps everything running smoothly - even if he struggled with my Scottish accent!! We stayed here for last week for the last of a long holiday but we'd sampled the breakfasts the previous year and had to go back for more! Rooms have everything you need and are very well priced- don't expect 5 star luxury but the price compares very favourably. Thanks Tony!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Value, Brilliant Position, Very Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: acerockolla
Reviews.Content: We were traveling around Australia for 3 months and much of it was dull with very basic motels, there were one or two exceptions but on the whole our temporary homes were not much to talk about. The City Crown Motel in Sydney was one of the exceptions and was a very big part of our trip because of that. We turned up unannounced and with a car full off luggage (there are four of us traveling for a year and occasionally when our son turns up there are five) at this point there were four of us (on our return there were five). The owner Tony was at the desk when I pulled up after having tried and failed to find a place to stay at Bondi, our Navman had taken us to Tonyâ€™s door. He could not have been more accommodating if he had been a family member. We got the car in the garage and we had two rooms at a very good price. The rooms are not super luxury but for the price they are excellent, clean and comfortable, the beds are nice and roomy. The CityLife also has the benefit of a Cafe on the ground floor and this is not some grotty little cafe as the queues at the window of the locals and local workers proved. No the food and drink served here are of the highest standard and in three months it was the only Motel we ate more than one meal at and the only place we ate because we wanted too rather than because it was the only place open for miles around, in fact there we only one day we did not eat there. There are also a big selection of free DVDâ€™s that you can borrow. Tony proved to be the ultimate host and his staff are also very friendly and helpful. The real gem here though is the position, the City Crown is on Crown Street in the Surrey Hills area of Sydney, itâ€™s a short ten minute walk to the centre but that ten minutes is through the coolest most bohemian area of Sydney. We stayed at the City Crown again some four weeks later, one phone call was all it took and Tony organised it, when we couldnâ€™t make it on the day we said we would arrive due to our car imploding Tony was not fazed and did not charge us, we arrived the following day to a great welcome. When we left we bought Tony and Anne Marie (his wife) some flowers as a thank you. I could think of no better endorsement for this place, great people, great food and great position.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliness makes up for basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BexsterF
Reviews.Content: Travelling on my own can sometimes get lonely. However, Tony and his team were welcoming from the very start and made my stay like being with family. Brilliant staff, fabulous brekkies and free wireless (which is actually worth a lot if you've ever looked into how much hotels charge!). It is a 'motel'... i.e. the corridors are not plush, the rooms are basic however, it is comfortable and well placed and I felt safe. I would recommend this place to other grown up travellers, probably not families or older people though. The staff are the big plus for this place, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: brylit3
Reviews.Content: I have reserved the hotel for 5 nights on the website and when I arrived at the hotel it was very small no elevator and for the price we can get better HOTEL so the receptionist was give us the choice to pay now the 5 nights or to pay only one night to try, we had chose to pay one night and to try, she said there will be no fee if we choose to leave after this one night. After a poor night we have decided to change hotel and we were leaving and another young receptionist had confirm that there will be no fee so we were happy to change hotel. Big surprise when I arrived to tahiti my bank told me that city crown have count 1 more night for the two rooms!! unbelievible!! I try to contact them for refund me but they don't want. I will complaint with office of fair trading.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJS49
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Sydney in advance of my trip to check out accommodations, and was shown a small but nice room with outdoor seating area and booked it. When I arrived with my family, I was told that room was unavailable, and was given a dirty, small room without outdoor area--a classic "bait and switch." I would avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ixchel94610
Reviews.Content: Friendly Staff and excellent location. Accomodations were basic, great water pressure in the shower which was a plus. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Beachie84
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the City Crown with my daughter for a week in January and was thrilled with our find. Room rates are very competitive (we paid around AU$100 for a double room), and due to a last minute cancellation we were upgraded to a deluxe room for no extra charge. As was expected, the room was quite small, but had everything we needed (TV, DVD, bar fridge, new ensuite bathroom, desk, balcony, coffee/tea, wireless internet etc) and had obvously been recently renovated. The staff were incredible, unlike any we have experienced before, and made us feel at home straight away. Location was brilliant, 10 minute walk to Hyde Park/CBD, 2 mins to Oxford St, heaps of great bars and restaurants very close. The on-site Cafe was also excellent, particularly the breakfast menu. The only negatives would be the appearance of the hallways (we were told that the owners are still in the process of renovating), size of rooms, very limited lock-up parking (book ahead), and minor damage to some of the furniture. Overall a great stay and I would recommend to anyone looking for affordable accommodation in central Sydney.

HotelInfo.Name: City Crown Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 289 Crown St., Sydney, New South Wales 2010, Australia
